text.title: Live As a Gandhian
text.head: Live As a Gandhian
text.p:
Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi , also known as
Mahatma
Gandhi , was a famous figure who helped lead India to independence . After returning to India after studying in South Africa , Gandhi began spreading his philosophy , and many Gandhian ideas are still taught and followed to this day . This wikiHow will take you through some core tenets of Gandhian philosophy , and help you live as a Gandhian .
text.head: Steps
Learning About Gandhism

list.item: Learn about Gandhi . Learning about Gandhi and how he lives his life can help you learn how to better live as a Gandhian , as Gandhi exemplifies the values outlined below .

Read Gandhi 's works . Read through Gandhi 's works and discourses to familiarize yourself with Gandhian philosophy . Some books to consider reading include :
The Story of My Experiments with Truth
is Gandhi 's autobiography , and a must-read for anyone wishing to learn about Gandhism . In it , Gandhi writes about his life and how he developed his ideas .
Discourses on the Gita
is a book written by Gandhi that deals with faith and one 's relationship with God . If you 're planning on reading this , be sure to read the Bhagwad Gita first .
The Words of Gandhi
was written by the director of the award winning movie
Gandhi
and is a compilation of essays , letters , and discourses by Gandhi .

text.head: Living By Gandhian Principles

list.item:
Prioritize means over ends . Gandhi strongly believed in the primacy of means over ends . Even the noblest goal must be pursued only through the right means , even if it means it takes longer to achieve . For instance , Gandhi highly valued nonviolence , and chose to attain his goals only through nonviolent means .
Before taking any hasty action , ask yourself - am I going about this the right way ? Can I be sure that my action does not violate the fundamental principles of truth and nonviolence ?
Do n't avoid concerning yourself with ends altogether . The realization of truth and pursuit of
Brahman
are not incompatible with pursuing noble goals .

Center your life around the search for
satya
, or Truth . Gandhian philosophy lays heavy emphasis on searching for the truth and centering your life around it . The realization of Truth , according to Gandhi , comes from devoting your life to the search for truth , even at the expense of other worldly things .
Avoid falling prey to material pleasures . While they may be tempting , such things only distract one from the search for Truth .
Practice meditation
. Meditating helps you focus and be at peace with yourself , and aids the search for Truth .

Practice
Ahimsa
or Nonviolence . The idea of nonviolence is central to Gandhi 's philosophy . Throughout his fight for independence , Gandhi stressed the importance of passive and nonviolent forms of resistance .
Ahimsa
is not limited to action alone - Gandhians must cause no harm to any living creature , in thought or in deed .
Transition to a Vegetarian Lifestyle
, if you have n't already , so as to not indirectly hurt other living creatures .

Practice
Brahmacharya
.
Brahmacharya
, or the search for
Brahma
, is a complex concept that preaches celibacy , faith in God , and a mastery over one 's own actions such that one does not fall prey to the pleasures of the flesh . To practice Brahmacharya is to renounce activities that have no place in the path to
Brahma
.

Practice fasting
. To Gandhi , fasting was a way to cleanse and discipline the mind , body , and soul . It helps develop the mental fortitude necessary to practice Gandhi 's teachings . Gandhi himself fasted several times in his lifetime .

Respect all religions
. Gandhi believed in religious pluralism as a way of uniting people . Be open to all belief systems and respect them all .

Teach yourself to be self sufficient . Gandhi 's ideas of
swarajya
, which he outlined in his work
Hind Swaraj
, emphasize self-sufficiency and independence . Some ideas -
Learning to sew
your own clothes can be a great first step . Gandhi used a spinning wheel , or
charkha
, to make
khadi
, a kind of homemade cloth .
Grow your own food
. Gandhi was against the industrialization that makes most of our ready-to-eat food possible , so try to grow your own produce to use while cooking .

text.head: Tips

list.item: Learning to cut back on material desires can be hard . Take it slowly and eliminate vices not conducive to Gandhism step by step .

Watch films and documentaries on the life of Gandhi to learn more about him , such as
Gandhi
by Richard Attenborough .
Do n't confuse ' Truth ' ( capital t ) , the summation of all knowledge , with factual truth ( small t ) !
